titleStmt.title: The ansvver of the Lords and Commons to the Essex petition for a personall treaty, disbanding the army, and setling the kingdome. Also, a commission from the Prince of Wales, for securing and fortifying the town of Berwicke, and other places in the north. And a letter of the whole passages from thence. With a message from the Parliament of Scotland, to the Parliament of England, debated in the House on Thursday last.

The ansvver of the Lords and Commons to the Essex petition for a personall treaty, disbanding the army, and setling the kingdome. Also, a commission from the Prince of Wales, for securing and fortifying the town of Berwicke, and other places in the north. And a letter of the whole passages from thence. With a message from the Parliament of Scotland, to the Parliament of England, debated in the House on Thursday last.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Commons.
Scotland. Parliament.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
